page.title: 08SANDGATES, CHERTSEY
page.content: Sandgates is situated off the Guildford Road. It is a very large open area with an imposing house on the brow of the hill. There is a variety of terrain; open grassland, wooded copses and a stream. The house and grounds are used by the local Guides and Brownies for week-end camps, day visits and Brownie Revels. This year is the 75th Anniversary of Guiding and many activites have been organised. The local Brownie packs have used Sandgates to hold their annual Revels where they have competitions and refreshments. This year each Brownie lit a candle from the candle lit by Princess Margaret, the Guide President. Local Guide Companies camp here under canvas every week-end during the summer.
